line_1: Desp'rate he flew tow'rds where the fagots blaz'd,
line_2: But, ere he plung'd, from pious habit rais'd

line_1: Where once the gilded armour blaz'd,
line_2: The antient pile by time is raz'd,

line_1: Far other incense on their altars blaz'd:
line_2: Far other temples, other altars rais'd,

line_1: Indignant, and in light unborrow'd blaz'd.
line_2: On Nature with impassion'd look he gazed,

line_1: His milk-white steed with glittering trappings blazed,
line_2: On the fair squire with wonder Psyche gazed,

line_1: Quick through the trees a thousand torches blazed
line_2: To Psyche all irresolute, amazed:

line_1: I' th' highest rank of glory blaz'd:
line_2: Who, by imperial favour rais'd,

line_1: When the MESSIAH's Standard blaz'd!
line_2: See Hills, from their Foundations raz'd!

line_1: Bright o'er the floor the scatter'd fragments blaz'd,
line_2: And Gods retreating trembled as they gaz'd;

line_1: And far in Night celestial Beauty blaz'd.
line_2: Earth with deep yawn received the Fair, amaz'd,

line_1: With beauty blossom'd, and with virtue blaz'd,
line_2: Mark the fair Scions, that themselves have rais'd;

line_1: The cauldron bubbled, and the faggots blaz'd; —
line_2: On the loud shore a magic pile she rais'd,

line_1: Sweet breath'd the gale, and bright the censor blazed.
line_2: Her suppliant voice for sickening Loxa raised,

line_1: Bright o'er his brows the forky radiance blazed,
line_2: And high in air the rod divine He raised. —

line_1: Love within each bosom blaz'd.
line_2: Each in mutual wonder gaz'd;

line_1: As I drew near, the cottage blaz'd,
line_2: And through the windows long I gaz'd,

line_1: Her opening eye in humid lustre blazed,
line_2: And half relenting on her beauties gazed;

line_1: Her opening eye in humid lustre blazed,
line_2: Unseen he still remained, enchanted and amazed.

line_1: Conspicuous far a lofty palace blazed
line_2: Refreshed she rose, and all enchanted gazed

line_1: For four long centuries hath blaz'd.
line_2: Which in thy high-arch'd temple rais'd,

line_1: And bells rang loud, and every window blaz'd,
line_2: To Victory the sculptur'd arch was rais'd
